title: Emmys 2019 – live: Stars descend upon Hollywood as Game of Thrones, Fleabag and Chernobyl prepare to battle
text:
Another Emmy Awards ceremony is almost underway.

Speculation is rife as to who will walk away with the top prizes at the event, but Game of Thrones, Fleabag and Chernobyl are all hoping to be award prizes.

The Emmys begin at 7pm PST in Hollywood's Microsoft Theatre, which is 2am GMT in the UK. For the first time since 2003, there'll be no presenter, but the list of guest presenters include Tim Allen, James Corden, Kerry Washington, Regina King, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Bill Hader, Ben Stiller, Catherine O’Hara and Marisa Tomei.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Want to follow along with all the action? The Independent has you covered – we'll be updating you with all the red carpet arrivals, award winners and speeches as and when they happen.

Follow along with all the updates form the red carpet and the ceremony as it happens

Mandy Moore says she's "super excited" to have released new music for the first time in the decade and that she's touched that people still have interest in her songs. Mandy Moore has arrived! Photo by should read VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images Empire star Taraji P Henson says she misses Jussie Smollett, who's in all likelihood not returning for the show's sixth and final season. This Is Us star Milo Ventimiglia says he knew his co-star Mandy Moore was working on new music but that he didn't get to hear her new single before it was out. Photo by VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images Advertisement And here's the cast and crew of RuPaul's Drag Race: Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images James Van Der Beek, who plays Matt Bromley in Pose, says he always appreciates being at the Emmys due to having experienced career highs and lows. Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Here is our best-dressed gallery for the evening: All the best-dressed stars on the red carpet at the Emmy Awards Billy Bush is here. He recently returned to television following his firing after he was heard along with Donald Trump on the Access Hollywood tape in which the US president bragged about his perceived ability to "grab [women] by the p****". Photo by Matt Winkelmeyer/Getty Images Advertisement And here is Laverne Cox looking fantastic: Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Here are The Good Place's Manny Jacinto and Jameela Jamil: Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Photo by VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images Daina Reid, who directed The Handmaid's Tale's season two episode "Holly", brought the most amazing clutch tonight. Brett Gelman, who plays Claire's unbearable husband on Fleabag, jokes that he's the best ambassador for American people on the show. Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Advertisement Fleabag's Phoebe Waller-Bridge has arrived! She's nominated for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series and the show itself is up for Outstanding Comedy Series. Sian Clifford and Olivia Colman have also scored nominations in the Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series category. Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen says he had a "10-minute window" to nominate himself for an Emmy as his girlfriend was pregnant at the time. His co-star Gwendoline Christie also had to nominate herself for her work on the show. William Jackson Harper of The Good Place tells People and Entertainment Weekly that things feel "crazy" amid the Emmys frenzy. The Good Place is up for Outstanding Comedy Series tonight! Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images Red carpet coverage is about to begin! Stay tuned as the stars of the evening make their way to LA's Microsoft Theatre. Advertisement Another show expecting to win quite a few awards tonight is Sky Original/HBO series Chernobyl, which is loved more than The Sopranos and Breaking Bad on IMDb. https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/chernobyl-hbo-imdb-rating-breaking-bad-sopranos-game-thrones-sopranos-a8942996.html Reminder that Sian Clifford has been nominated for Fleabag, which is hands down the greatest nomination of them all. https://twitter.com/SiansUniverse/status/1174965693546037250 All the technical trophies were awarded at the Creative Arts ceremony last week; Thrones took home the most, while The Handmaid's Tale won Outstanding Guest Star awards for Cherry Jones and Bradley Whitford. While we have you, today is 15 years since a former Best Drama Emmy winner started – and to celebrate, we ranked every single episode. https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/features/lost-best-episodes-worst-ranked-list-15-year-anniversary-evangeline-lilly-matthew-fox-a9113681.html Advertisement 1 2 Next

Check back here after the ceremony for a full list of winners.
description: Another Emmy Awards ceremony is almost underway. Speculation is rife as to who will walk away with the top prizes at the event, but Game of Thrones, Fleabag and Chernobyl are all hoping to be award prizes.
